[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Bath Data Archive (BDA) defines functional and technical requirements for managing, depositing, and reusing research datasets.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BDA supports dataset deposits, metadata, licensing, embargoes, and access control.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BDA integrates with CRIS, LDAP, and APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BDA provides web-based workflows for dataset submission and metadata management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BDA operates on scalable university cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BDA supports REST APIs for automated deposits and metadata harvesting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: BDA optimizes resource allocation for handling large dataset uploads.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: BDA links to repositories and indexers.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BDA supports dataset deposits, licensing, embargoes, and citation tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: BDA serves depositors, researchers, administrators, and funding agencies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: BDA relies on university infrastructure and integrations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: BDA requires compliance with archival standards and persistent identifier systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Dataset: Research files stored in BDA.
DOI: Persistent identifier for dataset citation.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: SWORD2: Simple Web-service Offering Repository Deposit

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with CRIS and LDAP for authentication and metadata synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide SWORD2 APIs for automated deposits.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall enable metadata harvesting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow dataset deposits with auto-metadata (REQ-DB-91).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enforce licensing, embargoes, and access controls while linking datasets to publications (REQ-DSGN-001, REQ-DSGN-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall mint DOIs, track dataset citations, and support multilingual metadata management (REQ-PERF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive, web-based interface with familiar navigation (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall upload datasets within 10 sec.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 5,000 users while maintaining optimal response times (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata in an indexed relational DB and manage datasets in distributed storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and archival data protection standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt all data at rest and in transit.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 14721 for digital preservation compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure 99.9% system uptime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional tests for dataset deposits, licensing enforcement, and system performance benchmarks.
